{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3682789,"name":"Luiz","username":"LuizBrendler","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/l/3be4f8/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-07-17T14:43:21.751Z","cooked":"

Hi, how are you? Me and my team are having a problem with our VH-109 radio, the network in 2,4GHz is disabled and just the 6GHz are working. And, in addition, the computer can’t found the wifi network, even connected in ethernet cable. Our Robo RIO didn’t reconise the radio too, if you have any idea of what is happenig and if you have any doubt you can ask down below.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":21,"updated_at":"2025-07-17T14:43:21.751Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":219,"readers_count":218,"score":53.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":504356,"topic_slug":"2-4ghz-network-from-radio-vh-109-are-disabled","display_username":"Luiz","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":76494,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"LuizBrendler"},"post_url":"/t/2-4ghz-network-from-radio-vh-109-are-disabled/504356/1","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3682799,"name":"MetabolicCloth","username":"MetabolicCloth","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/metaboliccloth/{size}/9335_2.png","created_at":"2025-07-17T15:00:20.320Z","cooked":"

You need to enable the 2.4GHz radio via hardware. WPILIB Programming your Radio

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":21,"updated_at":"2025-07-17T15:00:20.320Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":208,"readers_count":207,"score":61.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":504356,"topic_slug":"2-4ghz-network-from-radio-vh-109-are-disabled","display_username":"MetabolicCloth","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://docs.wpilib.org/en/stable/docs/zero-to-robot/step-3/radio-programming.html#enable-2-4ghz-wifi-on-the-vh-109","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Programming your Radio — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation","clicks":2}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":33804,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/2-4ghz-network-from-radio-vh-109-are-disabled/504356/2","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3682800,"name":"Seth Crampton","username":"seth-crampton","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/e36b37/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-07-17T15:03:10.360Z","cooked":"

Does the laptop you’re using have Wifi 6e? If it doesn’t you won’t be able to connect directly to radio unless 2.4 is enabled. Are you seeing status lights on the radio?

Edit: looking at the documentation, it looks like you still need a 2nd radio in access point mode to connect via WiFi 6e on your laptop.

Vivid Hosting has guides, and a tool for finding/ configuring the radio I would start there. https://frc-radio.vivid-hosting.net/overview/programming-your-radio-at-home

Reprogramming is not quite the right term. If you are already on the latest firmware no “reprogramming” is necessary.

“Configure” or “re-configure” would be better terms - you need to basically give the SSID a new password, one that YOU know (as the event password or key is stored encrypted and unknown to all but the FMS and key-volunteers)

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":21,"updated_at":"2025-07-17T18:16:07.890Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":106,"readers_count":105,"score":41.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":504356,"topic_slug":"2-4ghz-network-from-radio-vh-109-are-disabled","display_username":"Joseph Walters","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":49599,"username":"seth-crampton","name":"Seth Crampton","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/e36b37/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63541,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/2-4ghz-network-from-radio-vh-109-are-disabled/504356/8","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3682949,"name":"Seth Crampton","username":"seth-crampton","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/e36b37/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-07-17T18:35:21.364Z","cooked":"

The guide uses both program and configure to mean the same thing.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":21,"updated_at":"2025-07-17T18:35:21.364Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":99,"readers_count":98,"score":24.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":504356,"topic_slug":"2-4ghz-network-from-radio-vh-109-are-disabled","display_username":"Seth Crampton","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":63541,"username":"Jwal","name":"Joseph Walters","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jwal/{size}/228161_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":49599,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/2-4ghz-network-from-radio-vh-109-are-disabled/504356/9","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3682959,"name":"Joseph Walters","username":"Jwal","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jwal/{size}/228161_2.png","created_at":"2025-07-17T18:52:26.047Z","cooked":"

It dosent really…

It uses “program” to refer to using the event programming kiosks - which may indeed update your radios firmware if it is outdated/not the required minimum to participate in a given event.

That is indeed programming new firmware.

Later on the page it switches to “configure” to indicate adjusting SSID and WPA Key.

I believe the use of the term “program the radio” (which I’ve often used myself but am training myself away from that language unless its exactly what I mean) - refers to the OMP5 and prior wireless access-points which indeed required a specific tool and re-write of a configuration file or the entire firmware to make connecting with the field radio possible.

With our new Vivid-Hosting radios this is not necessary, its just giving it a new WPA-Key (or password) through its web interface.
